title: Kalinga Super Cup 2025 Final : FC Goa Triumphs - Pragativadi I Latest Odisha News in English I Breaking News
body_text:
The heavens poured, but FC Goa shone brightest as they secured their second Kalinga Super Cup title with a resounding 3-0 victory over Jamshedpur FC at Kalinga Stadium in Bhubaneswar, Odisha, on Saturday night.
Borja Herrera was the architect of Goaâ€™s success, netting a brilliant brace (22â€™, 51â€™) before Dejan DraÅ¾iÄ‡ sealed the triumph with a composed finish in the 72nd minute. The win not only cemented FC Goaâ€™s place in history as the first team to win the Super Cup twice, but also booked their ticket to the AFC Champions League Two 2025-26, marking their return to Asian club competition after four years.

From the opening whistle, it was a battle of Goaâ€™s attacking firepower against Jamshedpurâ€™s reputed defence, which had remained unbreached throughout the tournament. However, the tides turned swiftly as Goa dominated possession and created chances at will. The breakthrough came in the 23rd minute when Herrera capitalised on a rebound from Aakash Sangwanâ€™s powerful strike, calmly placing the ball into the net.
Jamshedpur had a fleeting moment of hope when Lazar Ä†irkoviÄ‡â€™s header rattled the crossbar before halftime, but their inability to contain Goaâ€™s waves of attacks proved costly. The second goal arrived when Herrera unleashed a sensational 25-yard strike into the top corner, showcasing his finesse and precision. Goaâ€™s relentless charge culminated in DraÅ¾iÄ‡â€™s cool finish, assisted by Carl McHugh, in the 71st minute.
As rain drenched the iconic Kalinga Stadium, Goaâ€™s players danced in celebration, embracing the moment of their triumphant return to domestic supremacy. Head coach Manolo MÃ¡rquez, who concluded his tenure with this spectacular victory, described the night as â€œpure footballing bliss.â€
Borja Herrera was rightfully awarded the Kalinga Player of the Match, capping off his stellar performance. This emphatic victory not only reinforced FC Goaâ€™s attacking pedigree but also signified a new chapter in their legacy.
